name: gallop
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] (of a horse) to run fast so that all four feet come off the ground together in each act of forward movement, or (of a person) to ride a horse that is running in this way: We galloped through the woods. Compare
canter verb
trot noun (RUN)
[ I usually + adv/prep ] informal to move or act quickly: It is the height of folly and a tragic waste to gallop into war.
